gurmukhi: sRaun pÍwh mno srqw iqh m`iD DsI kir loQ krwry ]142]
transliteration: Sraoun Pravaah Mano Sartaa Tih Maddh(i) Dhasoo Kar(i) Loth Kardare||142||
translation: Within the flowing stream of blood are drowned the corpses formulating the banks (of the stream).142.

gurmukhi: AYsy pry DrnI pr bIr su kY kY duKMf ju cMfih fwry ]
transliteration: Aise Dare Dharnoo Par Boor Su Kai Kai Doukhanndju Chaaadah(i) Ddare||
translation: In this way, the warriors cut into halves by Chandi, are lying on the ground.

gurmukhi: loQn aUpr loQ igrI bih sRaux cilE jnu kot pnwry ]
transliteration: Lothan Oopar Loth Giroo Bah(i) Sraoun Chadio Jan(u) Kot Pandare||
translation: The corpse hath fallen on the corpses and the blood is flowing enormously as if millions of spouts are feeding the flow.

gurmukhi: lY kir ibXwl so ibXwl bjwvq so aupmw kiv XO mn Dwry ]
transliteration: Lai Kar(i) Bidaal So Bidaal Bajaavat So Oupmaa Kav(i) Yau Man Dhdare||
translation: The elephants are bumped against the elephants and the poet imagines it like this;

gurmukhi: mwno mhwN pRley bhy paun so Awps mYN iBrhYN igr Bwry ]143]
transliteration: Maano Mahaan Pralae Bade Paoun So Aapas Main Bhirhain Gir Bhdare||143||
translation: That with blowing of the wind each other.143.

gurmukhi: lY kr mY Ais dwrun kwm kry rn mY Ar so ArnI hY ]
transliteration: Lai Kar Mai As(i0 Daaroun Kaam Dare Ran Mai Ar So Arnoo Hai||
translation: Holding her terrible sword in her hand, Chandi hath begun her function with powerful movement in the battlefield.

gurmukhi: sUr hny bil kY blvwn su sRaux cilau bih bYqrnI hY ]
transliteration: Soor Hane Bal(i) Kai Balvaan Su Sraoun Chadio Bah(i) Baitarnoo Hai||
translation: With great force she hath killed many warriors and their flowing blood seems like Vaitarni stream.

gurmukhi: bwNh ktI AD bIc qy suMf sI so aupmw kiv ny brnI hY ]
transliteration: Baanh Katoo Adh Boodhe Te Sound Soo So Oupmaa Kav(i0 Ne Barnoo Hai||
translation: The arm like the trunk of the elephant hath been cut in the middle and the poet hath depicted it like this;

gurmukhi: Awpis mY lr kY su mno igr qy igrI srp kI duie GrnI hY ]144]
transliteration: Aapas(i) Mai Lar Ka Su Mano Girt E Giroo Sarap Koo Due Gharnoo Hai||144||
translation: That fighting with each other two she-serpents hath dropped doen.144.

gurmukhi: skl pRbl dl dYq ko cMfI dieE Bjwie ]
transliteration: Sakal Prabal Dal Dait Ko Channdoo Daio Bhajaae||
translation: Chandi hath caused all the mighty army of the demons to run away.

gurmukhi: pwp qwp hir jwp qy jYsy jwq prwie ]145]
transliteration: Paap Taap Har(i) Jaap Te Jaise Jaat Paraae||145||
translation: Just as with the remembrance of the Name of the Loard, the sins and sufferings are removed.145.
